Fields.DialogueText: Voykov! Can you please do me a favor?
What? You think because I'm your friend that I automatically do favors for you?
That's... That's not what I was thinking at all. I just have a task for you to do because I'm your captain...

Fields.MenuText: I was just wondering if you could help the crew repaint part of the ship.
I'm a little scared to tell you now... but the crew needs help repainting part of the ship.
Nothing, nothing...

Fields.DialogueText: Da, Kapitan. Anything for this ship.
Don't be scared to tell me anything. You know I have strong loyalties to this ship.
Please tell me. I'm sorry I can be a little... scary, but I will do whatever it takes to keep the ship in tip-top shape!
Wow... For the ship, but not for your dear, old friend the Captain?
You're just trying to make me feel guilty. We could've been such good friends, what a shame. Oh well, let's just go fight those Neizvestniy flot... separately.
Wait... Was that a joke? I can't tell when you're joking, Voykov! Voykov?!
@BATTLE
Oh... Um, what is it?
How are you doing today, Voykov? Voykov? Hello?
What? Oh, uh, sorry. I guess I was just really lost in my book...
No time for reading right now! The Morganas are here.
@BATTLE
Oh my gosh, oh my gosh. Nyet nyet nyet...
What's going on, Voykov? Are you hurt?!

Fields.MenuText: Calm down, it's just a book. Why are you going crazy over some ink and paper?
It has to be somewhere. Don't worry. I'm sure you just set it down when the fighting began.
Not your book! That's terrible... Damn it, we have to find it! You can't lose a treasure like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Really, Kapitan?! Books are such an important part of our culture! How can you not love them with every fiber of your being?
What if we can't, though? I was in the middle of such a good part...
I know! I knew I shouldn't have brought it up on deck... It's too precious.
Oh wait, is that it right there?
Da! I hope it's okay!
Oh... No "thank you"...?
I lost my book! What if it went overboard? What if one of the Neizvestniy flot took it?! They don't deserve that kind of knowledge!
*ALARM*
Day One of my audio diary. All is well on the ship...
Voykov, what in the world are you doing?
Kapitan! You're ruining my audio diary! Stop talking!
Oh... Uh, sorry? I'm sorry.
Ah, never mind. I guess I'll just pause it now.
Did I interrupt something important?

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a pretty good idea. It's definitely a lot easier than writing.
Why don't you just write them down? It seems a lot more efficient to keep a pen and paper tucked into your pocket.
Sounds kind of boring. Why waste your time recording the past when you could live in the moment?

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I was thinking. It's a lot easier to just speak into a recording device than to scribble on hundreds of pieces of paper. I always lose them anyway.
You would think so, but I always end up losing those papers. I have so many of them that it's hard to keep track.
I want to remember everything that goes on here. Being on this ship has been one of the most fascinating experiences of my entire life.
It's good to see that you're so dedicated to something. I always worry that you detach yourself too much from things.
What's that supposed to mean? Never mind. Was there a reason why you came down here?
Oh, right! There's Morganas approaching the ship and I needed the entire crew on deck... So I guess we should really go to that now...
@BATTLE
Not really, I guess. I just thought it would be fun to start recording audio diaries so I can keep track of my ideas and adventures while I'm aboard this ship.
You are too easily distracted, Kapitan. I would not forget about an attack from the Neizvestniy flot...
How in the world do you use this contraption? Voykov, are you sure this is a good idea?
You just have to press that little button there to start the recording. And da, I'm sure. What better person to interview for my audio diary than the kapitan of my favorite ship?
I'm flattered! Am I really your favorite captain?

Fields.MenuText: Being able to command an entire crew of people who have to listen to me. Final answer.
I honestly just enjoy being out on the ocean for extended periods of time. It's my favorite place to be and I'm so happy that I get to do this for a living.
I like being a leader for the people on this ship. I feel like I have some sort of purpose.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know if that's an entirely appropriate answer... I guess the truth is the truth...
That's a very good answer. It's always nice when your job doesn't feel like work.
It's great that you enjoy helping people. I can definitely tell that you're a natural leader. Everything on this ship flows like a well-oiled machine.
So is that it?
Well, don't sound too eager to leave... But yes, that's it... For today.
Good, because there's some Morganas quickly approaching the ship. We need to get everyone ready for battle!
@BATTLE
That's not exactly what I said, but yes. I suppose you are my favorite kapitan. Back to the topic at hand... What exactly is your favorite part about being the captain of a ship?
Remember what I said about Neizvestniy flot attacks? How do you ignore these things and not tell me right away?
Voykov? Ah, I can't believe I'm coming to you for this...
What is it, Kapitan?
I'm so embarrassed... I should be the captain... I should be teaching you things. I can't believe this...
Stop beating around the bush! What is it that you require?
Can you... Can you teach me how to fight?
That was it? Why'd it take you so long to ask?!
Because I'm the captain and you should be learning something from me... I don't know. I just feel like I'm not fit to be a captain.

Fields.MenuText: I don't think so! I should be the leader of everything on this ship, but I'm not in fighting.
I am not incapable, but I need to learn how to fight better.
Fine! Maybe I don't need your help then!

Fields.DialogueText: You're not going to be good at everything, Kapitan. Everyone has their weak points.
Don't worry about that. You are completely qualified to be a captain. Just because you need help in certain areas doesn't mean that you're not fit to run a ship.
Da. You do.
There's some Neizvestniy flot hags out there now. Let's go out and see where you stand with fighting right now.
@BATTLE
That's absolutely ridiculous.
Okay, so do you have that down?
I think so... Maybe not, can you show me again?

Fields.MenuText: Always remain on the offensive!
Never let your guard down!
Try to anticipate your opponent's next move.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, that's very important, but not the most important.
I suppose that's necessary to do, but it's not the most important thing to me.
That's always a good tactic, but there's something that's even more important.
So what is it?
You just can't care. You have to detach yourself from all emotions and just not care about what you're doing.
...Voykov? Are you okay?
Da, Kapitan! Let's go test your fighting skills out on some Morganas!
@BATTLE
Nyet, you are fine. I know you can do it, we should move on to the next thing. Do you know what the most important part of fighting is?
Voykov, I need to talk to you about a rather... serious matter.
I would never dream about having anything other than a serious conversation with you. What is it?
I'm extremely concerned about you. I knew there was something slightly off about you, but... that battle we fought together really showed me another side of you.
I'm not sure I know exactly what you're referring to.
I can't stop thinking about how you told me to just get rid of all my emotions and not care about anything.

Fields.MenuText: I always fight with 100% of my ability, but I can't bring myself to not care.
I don't think I'm able to just not care about what I'm doing. I hate hurting things, even if it's the Morganas. I try to see them as just practice dummies, but it doesn't always work.
I suppose I can be a little ruthless, but there's a difference between that and simply becoming... Inhuman.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the only way I can fight. So what if it leaks into my day to day life?
Then I guess we have more to work on!
Inhuman? I'm not inhuman! Nowhere near it! I can't believe you would accuse me of such a thing.
I'm telling you this as a friend
Spasibo... I guess.
I hope you heed my advice. There's some Morganas out there now. Maybe you can try not being so... robotic and emotionless. No offense...
None taken, I guess... Let's go.
@BATTLE
That's just how I fight. I don't see the problem with that. What do you do?
Kapitan! I've been trying.
Trying what? What in the world are you talking about?

Fields.MenuText: I'm very sorry about that... I don't know what came over me.
I was just being honest! I'm not going to sugarcoat things for you.
Maybe I could have phrased it a bit better, but it needed to be said. It was very worrying.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet, you were absolutely right. I want to thank you for bringing it to my attention.
Understood. Tough love is the only way to really drive something into someone's head.
I'm sorry that I ever worried you, I didn't mean to. Thank you for being harsh, though. I really needed that.
So have you made any improvements so far?
Absolutely! You look very aesthetically pleasing in that outfit.
Uh... I suppose that's a slight improvement. The awkwardness will wear off eventually. Here's the real test, though
Da, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
Not being cold and unfeeling! Like you said I was...
Everyone on deck! Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Voykov, what was that?!
What do you mean, Captain?
Your fighting seemed sloppy at best! The results were acceptable, but... it felt strange. What's happening to you?

Fields.MenuText: Forget it, forget this whole thing. I want the old Voykov back. This is not working out at all.
Do you really think you can stick to it? I'd really like it if you could try to show a little more emotion.
Improve? It didn't feel like improvement. Or progress towards improvement. I didn't like what I saw.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? Are you being completely honest? ... I'm so relieved. This has been so difficult.
Honestly? I don't think I can do it. This really isn't working out for me, Kapitan.
I'm actually relieved to hear you say that. I've been looking for an excuse to go back to my old self.
So I have my ruthless Voykov back?
I suppose so.
I've really missed her.
I've missed her too.
I'm not going to lie... This new fighting style is taking some getting used to. I think I'm almost there, though. I just want to improve my contributions to this ship!
Audio diary, number-
Voykov!
You interrupted me again! I'm never going to be able to get one of these audio diaries done without any unwanted voices.
You're needed in the bridge. The Morganas are back!
@BATTLE
Can't I just get a little peace around here for once? Now I'm going to need complete silence while I record this.
My lips are sealed.

Fields.MenuText: You can say that again!
It wasn't that bad! You did an... okay job.
You should mention that you did at least give it your all. Isn't that the most important part?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain!! What did I tell you?!
Gee, thanks. Spasibo, Kapitan. I'm glad you interrupted me for that.
Honestly, I really didn't try that hard. I knew it wasn't going to work out from the beginning... Drat! Now that's on the recording...
I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I'll stop talking.
It's too late. I already lost my train of thought.
I'll leave you alone to try and get it back on track then. Have fun!
I have come to learn quite a few things during this voyage. Most recently, I discovered that I can't be separated from my ruthless attitude. It only ends in disaster.
Kapitan? Where are you?
I'm busy trying to fend off the Morganas! Please come help!
@BATTLE
Damn, that was a rough one...
Was it?
Not bothered at all, are you, Voykov? Why were you looking for me? Before, I mean.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, fine. Bye, Voykov!
You can't just do that! I'm interested now.
I'm just going to stand here until you tell me. Even if the ship is burning to the ground, I will remain here forever.

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet! Come back and I'll tell you...
Fine. I'll tell you if you're going to whine so much. Hahaha!
Can ships even burn to the ground? Forget it, I'll tell you.
Just because I don't feel anything doesn't mean I can't be friends with anyone. I especially like people who I've been on ships with for extended periods of time.
That's reassuring, Voykov.
I'm leaving now. There's only so much of this I can handle...
It's not important anymore. Never mind.
"Audio journal number 46. I have befriended the kapitan."

Fields.MenuText: "I am becoming increasingly angry with the captain. My jealousy grows. I find myself wondering how one person could be so amazing."
"Last remarks."
"Help! A giant monster is trying to eat me! She's right next to me! I think she's going to kill me!!"

Fields.DialogueText: Truly a comedic genius.
Does my voice really sound that bad?
A-plus acting, Captain. You deserve an Oscar.
This thing is a lot of fun! Do you think I could borrow it for a couple days?
Certainly not! It has some very private stuff on it!
Oh, like what?
That's... That's not important right now.
You got very lucky, Voykov. The Morganas have come to your rescue. I wonder who's truly the monster in this situation.
You maybe?
You're just jealous that my recordings are better than yours! Haha, we should show them to the Morganas!
Absolutely not! Stop dilly-dallying. The rest of the crew is probably lost without you.
Not a single word of that was accurate. Just leave that stuff to me. I don't know if I can trust you anymore.
Hello, Voykov! Voykov? Are you doing all right?
I'm fine, I just feel a little nauseated.
Are you going to have another seizure? We could get you to lie down and relax a bit.
Kapitan, nyet! It's not that. The waves are just particularly bad today. I'm fine. Please don't panic.
I'm sorry... I'm just worried because you didn't tell me last time, so there's no guarantee you'll tell me if it happens again!
I promise I will. Don't worry about that.
So why in the world didn't you tell me last time?

Fields.MenuText: That's ridiculous! Weakness, ha! You're one of the best crew members on this ship, epileptic or not.
I don't think it shows weakness, but I don't want anything to happen to you.
I'm pretty sure you would've just beaten me up if I had tried to tell you can't do something.

Fields.DialogueText: Do you really think so? Everyone has their strengths and weaknesses, ... but I'll take that compliment anyway!
I wouldn't have let anything happen to myself. You are my kapitan, but I would still go and do everything that you told me not to.
I can't say that you're wrong...
I'm still going to be keeping a watchful eye on you. However, I'm not going to prevent you from doing anything. Who else would fight Morganas as well as you do? Let's make this a quick fight.
@BATTLE
I just thought... I thought that you would see it as a sign of weakness and prevent me from being involved on the ship.
Audio diary number four. Acquiring epilepsy was a very big mistake.
Having epilepsy isn't a choice.

Fields.MenuText: That seems a bit... ambitious. I think you should leave that to medical professionals.
Please, not on my ship. I don't want you to accidentally poison my entire crew.
We do have a bunch of supplies with us... Why not give it a shot?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't trust those ''professionals...''
It wouldn't the your entire crew. I'd just test it on a couple people.
Kapitan, I am not trained in the medical field. How could you suggest that?
I suppose when medical science has a cure, we'll know about it.
That assumption seems safe, Kapitan.
Until then, Morganas are the biggest threat to our health.
On that, we can agree.
@BATTLE
Maybe I could've tried harder to cure it or something.
Voykov! I need you! The Morganas are back and there's a lot of them!
I'm always ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Oh my god, Voykov! What's that?!
What's what?
There's a huge gash on your arm!
Where? Oh, there! It's fine, it's not that bad.
Are you kidding me?! It's huge and it's bleeding profusely!

Fields.MenuText: Surprisingly enough, I trust you to do that. Just call if you need anything.
Absolutely not! Come with me, we're going to find someone.
Fine, but I'll be watching over your shoulder the entire time just to make sure nothing goes awry.

Fields.DialogueText: You certainly do have a high opinion of me. I really appreciate that.
Nyet! I can do this by myself. The only person I trust is myself.
I refuse.
The next time you see me, I'll be in tip-top shape!
Oh god, I hope you're okay...
I'll just go take care of it myself.
Kapitan! Neizvestniy flot on the horizon!
Point them out. I don't see anything, yet.
Right there! On the horizon. How can you not see them?
I... What? Maybe? I see some specks. Is that them?
Da, isn't it obvious? To my eyes it is. We need to prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Voykov, how were you able to see those Morganas from so far away?!

Fields.MenuText: I certainly can't. I have terrible vision!
I mean, I thought my vision was pretty good - but obviously it could be far better!
Belles have freakishly good senses.

Fields.DialogueText: I never stopped to think that other people might not see like this... That must be terrible! How do you live?
True... You couldn't even see those Neizvestniy flot...
Or maybe you're the freak of nature and I am normal. How does that feel?
How good are you at seeing at night?
I can see at night just as well as I can during the day.
How would you feel about becoming our main lookout at night? The rest of the crew certainly cannot compare!
I would love to, Kapitan, and I appreciate the opportunity. I guess I better start getting more sleep during the day...
Can't everyone see like that?
Voykov! Are you having fun out here?
So much fun! I haven't been this excited in a while! Day or night, I love being outside... and not being around people.
I hope that doesn't include me.
We'll see on that one.
W- what? Voykov, we're friends, right?
Sure we are... Kapitan, a pack of Neizvestniy flot scum-heads is quickly moving towards us.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I was just coming to check up on my friend. I wanted to make sure you were okay.
I was worried you were burning down my ship. You and your crazy shenanigans.
I mean, I wasn't coming to check up on you or anything. I just needed to come check the wind patterns and waves and stuff...

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I'm okay! I'm the toughest person on this ship. I can hold my own in any fight.
Don't even joke about that! I would never do anything to harm this ship!
Sure, that makes sense... You're a very strange person.
Anyway, I should probably be get some rest. Have a good watch, Voykov!
So was there a reason you came out here?
Audio journal number five. It's been three days since I've gotten sleep.
What?! Voykov, go sleep!
Zzzz... What...?
Voykov, you're falling asleep as we speak!
... I believe in Trotsky...
I knew it!

Fields.MenuText: If you don't go to sleep right now, I'm going to take away your night lookout privileges.
I guess that's your decision... but falling asleep on watch is a crime.
I care about you so much... And you're just making me worry... Wow, I'm so sad...

Fields.DialogueText: Nyet! I'll go to sleep, I'll go to sleep!
Fine, I guess you can't afford to lose me. I'll sleep.
That's the worst guilt trip I've ever heard. I guess I'll sleep, though.
Wait! You can sleep right after we fight these Morganas! I need your expertise!
@BATTLE
... Sleep is for stupid people...
*ALARM*
Hello, Voykov. I need something from you.
What is it, Kapitan?
The crew belowdecks need some help moving some of the heavier crates. Would you be able to help them?
Absolutely. I'll be there right away.
I really appreciate it! ... Voykov? What's that?

Fields.MenuText: That... That full bottle of acid. I thought it was empty the last time I had checked. Why is it full now?
There's a full bottle of acid there that was once empty... You know what, you don't have to tell me. I don't want to know what kind of nefarious thing you're up to...
I'm going to assume that the once-empty, now-full bottle of acid on that table is decorative - not at all for any sort of malicious activities.

Fields.DialogueText: What full bottle of acid? ... I don't know what you're talking about.
You automatically assume I'm up to something nefarious? ... I'm flattered.
I thought you knew me, Kapitan. Why would you assume that?
Morganas... Don't think this conversation is over, though!
@BATTLE
I don't know what you're referring to, sir.
*ALARM*
It's such a beautiful day, isn't it, Voykov? Voykov? Are you crying?
Nyet. Crying is for sissies!

Fields.MenuText: Wow, not even when you were a baby?
O- okay. I'm sorry... I guess I was mistaken.
It's very clear that you're crying, now please tell me what's wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: Not even then... Now if you don't mind, I'd really like to be alone.
You definitely were.
There's nothing wrong because I'm not crying.
It's so obvious, Voykov. You can't even tell a friend what's going on in your mind? Who else are you supposed to trust?
I'm not scary. I'm not. I'm the friendliest they come. Why do people avoid me?
Do they really avoid you? Are you sure you're not just making it up?
Why would I make something like that up? People honestly avoid me... What's wrong with me?!
I... Um... The Morganas! I mean, they're back! Let's... Go fight them. Everyone on deck!
@BATTLE
I've never cried once in my life!
*ALARM*
Kapitan, can I ask you a personal question?
Depends on what it is.

Fields.MenuText: I think that everyone has a permanent soul no matter what. There are ways to strengthen it, though, like kind deeds and such.
It would probably have to be something like devoting your life to a certain cause. By believing in something so much and doing everything in your power to help it, you can regain your soul.
My guess would be that you have to do some enormous act of kindness and sacrifice. You have to do something unselfish and purely out of the goodness of your heart in order to get your soul back.

Fields.DialogueText: You really don't think that if a person has been truly terrible they can lose their soul? Or maybe even just pieces of it?
Do you think it could be anything? You just have to give your life meaning of some sort?
It would be really hard to come up with something like that...
You know as well as I do that I'm no god, though. I can't give you a real answer.
Oh, I know. It was just a hypothetical question anyway. People don't even have souls.
Are you sure? Because it really seems like you believe that...
Kapitan, the Morganas are back. Let's go beat them senseless.
@BATTLE
Well, I know we've talked about this before, but... I know your stance on people having souls or not.
I don't really believe they do, but hypothetically, how do you think someone can get it back once they've lost it?
*ALARM*
Audio diary number six. I've decided that today's topic is going to be deep.
Damn, Voykov. You're really going to impress your millions of listeners.

Fields.MenuText: Do you mean a soul? Souls exist.
A conscience?
An empty black hole of nothingness?

Fields.DialogueText: You're entitled to your opinion... But you're wrong.
Actually, da! That is exactly what I am thinking of.
For some people that's true... I've had a pretty rough life...
In the place of the soul there is humanity and morality. There's a sort of ''compass'' inside everyone that tells you what to do and guides you. Not a magical soul, however.
That was beautiful... Maybe there is a deeper side of you.
Never! Don't you dare utter those words!
Want to hear something even worse? Morganas. They're back. We should get to the main deck.
@BATTLE
Don't be mean. I already knew that souls are nonexistent, but I thought there must be something in its place.
Voykov? Are you busy?
Not that busy. Is there something you need?
Not really. I just wanted to let you know that I'm really glad you're on this ship.

Fields.MenuText: I was just trying to have a moment with you... A real heart to heart with the the warmest Belle I know.
I thought since we were friends we could share what was on our minds. I guess not. I really should've known that about you at this point, though...
Please just accept this for once. It would mean a lot to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Haha, very funny. Sarcasm must be your favorite emotional crutch.
I can't say that you shouldn't have. We have known each other for awhile.
Fine. And Kapitan, you inspire me every day.
I don't know what to say to that... Luckily the Morganas are preventing me from having to come up with something! Onward!
@BATTLE
Voykov? Voykov?! Where are you?!
That... That was incredibly sappy. I can't even lie.
Hello, Kapitan. How have you been?
Voykov? You've been go for so long! Where were you?
It hasn't been that long. Don't be so dramatic.
I guess not, but still... I had no idea where you were. I thought something had happened to you.
Nyet, nyet, nothing like that. I was simply taken captive by the Morganas and held on their ship until one day I craftily escaped.
What?

Fields.MenuText: Voykov, I was scared to lose you.
Promise me you'll never do that to me again.
Trying to take some of the glory away from me, huh Voykov?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not an idiot. I knew I was going to free myself. I had the whole thing planned out, trust me.
I can't promise anything like that. My loyalty lies with my ship and my Kapitan. There's nothing I wouldn't do.
I'm just trying to give it to the person who deserves it the most. Hahaha!
Voykov... I'm sorry to have to ask this of you, but can you still fight more Morganas? I understand if you're traumatized or anything, but-
@BATTLE
It is like I said, Kapitan.
You are an idiot, of course, Kapitan. I was not captured. But I discovered two things. You are gullible. Also, you care about me.
*ALARM*
I have to hand it to you, Kapitan...
What are you handing to me? Haha...
I was trying to tell you how much respect I have for you. Do you not like my compliments?
Lighten up a little bit, Voykov! You're not going to enjoy life if you don't laugh sometimes.

Fields.MenuText: You "think?!" I'm so offended, Voykov! After all we've been through...
I am truly honored. I know how you are, and this means a lot to me.
How could you ever think of leaving me? I'm so amazing, aren't I?

Fields.DialogueText: There you go with the jokes again! I'm trying to be extremely serious here.
You... You know how I am? What does that mean?
I know you're being sarcastic, but you are a great person... Even with the amount of jokes you make.
Come on, Voykov. You know your friendship means a lot to me, too.
Spasibo, Kapitan. Are you ready to leap into battle again? The Neizvestniy flot have returned.
I'm ready if you are.
@BATTLE
I enjoy life just fine! I'm always so prepared to jump from place to place in my life, but being your friend is something I don't think I'm going to want to leave.
